red_flag_combinations.message: A sudden 'thunderclap' headache that's the worst of your life could be bleeding in the brain (subarachnoid hemorrhage). This is a life-threatening emergency.
Headache with a stiff neck and fever could be meningitis. This needs emergency treatment.
Headache with weakness or numbness on one side could be a sign of a stroke. This is an emergency – call 911.
Headache with trouble speaking could be a sign of a stroke. This is an emergency – call 911.
Sudden severe headache with forceful vomiting may be a sign of bleeding in the brain.
Headache after a head injury with confusion could mean a serious brain injury. This needs urgent evaluation.
A head injury while on blood thinners raises the risk of bleeding in the brain. This needs a CT scan urgently.
Severe headache with vision loss or double vision needs urgent evaluation to rule out serious causes.
A new type of headache that's the worst you've ever had is a red flag that needs emergency evaluation.
